summary.para: Retrieves the capabilities of the palette object.

param.name: unnamedParam1
param.para: A pointer to a variable that receives a value from the dwPalCaps member of the structure that defines palette capabilities. This value consists of one or more of the following flags.

item.description: DDPCAPS_1BIT - The index is 1 bit. There are two entries in the color table.
DDPCAPS_2BIT - The index is 2 bits. There are four entries in the color table.
DDPCAPS_4BIT - The index is 4 bits. There are 16 entries in the color table.
DDPCAPS_8BIT - The index is 8 bits. There are 256 entries in the color table.

DDPCAPS_8BITENTRIES - The index refers to an 8-bit color index. This flag is valid only when used with the DDPCAPS_1BIT, DDPCAPS_2BIT, or DDPCAPS_4BIT flag, and when the target surface is 8 bpp. Each color entry is 1 byte long and is an index to a destination surface's 8-bpp palette.

DDPCAPS_ALPHA - The peFlags member of the associated PALETTEENTRY structure must be interpreted as a single 8-bit alpha value (in addition to the peRed, peGreen, and peBlue members). A palette created with this flag can be attached only to a texture: a surface created with the DDSCAPS_TEXTURE capability flag.
DDPCAPS_ALLOW256 - This palette can have all 256 entries defined.
DDPCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACE - This palette is attached to the primary surface. Changing this palette's color table immediately affects the display unless DDPSETPAL_VSYNC is specified and supported.

DDPCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACELEFT - This palette is the one attached to the left-eye primary surface. Changing this palette's color table immediately affects the left-eye display unless DDPSETPAL_VSYNC is specified and supported.
DDPCAPS_VSYNC - This palette can have modifications to it synchronized with the monitor's refresh rate.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, the return value is DD_OK.
If it fails, the method can return one of the following error values:

item.description: DDERR_INVALIDOBJECT
DDERR_INVALIDPARAMS

remarks.para: You must use to explicitly link to Ddraw.dll and then use to access the GetCaps method.

summary.para: Retrieves palette values from a DirectDrawPalette object.

param.name: unnamedParam1
param.para: Currently not used and must be set to 0.

param.name: unnamedParam2
param.para: Start of the entries to be retrieved sequentially.

param.name: unnamedParam3
param.para: Number of palette entries that can fit in the array that lpEntries specifies. The colors of the palette entries are returned in sequence, from the value of the dwStartingEntry parameter through the value of the dwCount parameter minus 1. (These parameters are set by .)

param.name: unnamedParam4
param.para: An array of PALETTEENTRY structures that receives the palette entries from the DirectDrawPalette object. The palette entries are 1 byte each if the DDPCAPS_8BITENTRIES flag is set, and 4 bytes otherwise. Each field is a color description.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, the return value is DD_OK.
If it fails, the method can return one of the following error values:

item.description: DDERR_INVALIDOBJECT
DDERR_INVALIDPARAMS
DDERR_NOTPALETTIZED

remarks.para: You must use to explicitly link to Ddraw.dll and then use to access the GetEntries method.

param.name: unnamedParam1
param.para: A pointer to the DirectDraw object to associate with the DirectDrawPalette object.

param.name: unnamedParam2
param.para: Currently not used and must be set to 0.

param.name: unnamedParam3
param.para: Currently not used and must be set to NULL.

returns.para: This method is provided for compliance with the Component Object Model (COM). Because the DirectDrawPalette object is initialized when it is created, this method always returns DDERR_ALREADYINITIALIZED.

remarks.para: You must use to explicitly link to Ddraw.dll and then use to access the Initialize method.

summary.para: Changes entries in a DirectDrawPalette object immediately.

param.name: unnamedParam1
param.para: Currently not used and must be set to 0.

param.name: unnamedParam3
param.para: Number of palette entries to be changed.

param.name: unnamedParam4
param.para: An array of PALETTEENTRY structures that contains the palette entries that SetEntries uses to change the DirectDrawPalette object. The palette entries are 1 byte each if the DDPCAPS_8BITENTRIES flag is set, and 4 bytes otherwise. Each field is a color description.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, the return value is DD_OK.
If it fails, the method can return one of the following error values:

item.description: DDERR_INVALIDOBJECT
DDERR_INVALIDPARAMS
DDERR_NOPALETTEATTACHED
DDERR_NOTPALETTIZED
DDERR_UNSUPPORTED

remarks.para: You must use to explicitly link to Ddraw.dll and then use to access the SetEntries method.
